subject: Horse Racing
lead_paragraph: Kentucky woefully trails other major horse racing states in the money dedicated to regulating the sport, and a report produced by a state task force suggested its claim as the horse capital of the world could be at risk without more cash soon. Owners of Kentucky-bred thoroughbreds are increasingly racing their animals outside of the state because of larger purse sizes and better funding of the regulations designed to keep races fair.
